summary:
As a Clinical Research Physician at Cardialysis, I work with a team of experts to design, conduct, and oversee clinical trials and studies in the field of cardiology. I have over 12 years of experience as an interventional cardiologist and a consultant of internal medicine in academic and hospital settings across Europe, where I performed complex coronary interventions, managed patients with acute and chronic cardiac conditions, and provided medical education and training to junior staff and students.

I am passionate about advancing the scientific knowledge and clinical practice of cardiology, and I have a PhD in interventional cardiology and intravascular imaging in acute coronary syndromes. I have also published multiple articles in peer-reviewed journals and received a prestigious student award for my research on percutaneous coronary interventions in patients with diabetes mellitus type 2. I am also proficient in English, German, and Croatian, and I have completed several certifications in medical device regulation and clinical research. At Cardialysis, I leverage my skills and expertise to contribute to the development and evaluation of novel and effective therapies and devices for cardiovascular diseases.

name: Dominic A. Theuns
summary:
Dominic A, Theuns PhD, is an assistant professor in cardiac devices at the Department of Cardiology, Erasmus Medical Center, Rotterdam (NL). His clinical activities include follow-up and trouble-shooting of CIED patients and is responsible for the medical device outpatient clinic. He is an EHRA certified cardiac device specialist.
For years, my clinical research is focused on risk modeling of mortality in CIED patients, especially patients treated with a CRT-D. Over the years, he developed an international collaboration with Basel University (prof Schaer), Seattle University (prof Levy) and recently with Toronto University (dr Alba). He has (co)authored over 220 original articles in peer-reviewed journals. He published a book on analysis of stored EGMs in ICDs, contributed to several chapters, such as ESC textbook of Cardiology and co-authored the 2nd edition of EHRA book on devices.  He was involved in the development of the subcutaneous ICD since 2005 and validated both the arrhythmia discrimination algorithm as well as the SMART Pass filter of this device.

Dominic graduated in exercise physiology from the University of Maastricht in 1991. He started as an allied professional at the Department of Cardiology, MUMC, Maastricht (NL). He was trained by prof Wellens and Smeets in interpreting ECGs, and developed the cardiac electrophysiology unit at the Department of Cardiology, Erasmus Medical Center, Rotterdam (NL) in 1998 with prof Jordaens. Erasmus MC is an EHRA Recognised Training Centre (ERTC).

Dr. Theuns is a Fellow of the European Society of Cardiology (FESC) and European Heart Rhythm Association (FEHRA). Furthermore, he is an active member of the Netherlands Society of Cardiology (NVVC) and Netherlands Heart Rhythm Association (NHRA). He is a member of the NHRA device advisory committee since 2006 and NVVC ICD task force member since 2021. In addition, he is an active member of the ESC and EHRA. He was associate editor of EP-Europace (2007-2022) and member and co-chair of the EHRA certication committee (2010 - 2022), Recently, he was appointed as ESC task force member in ACNAP and represents EHRA.

summary:
Combining my medical, scientific and industry experience, I am driven to improve lives. Always with the patient in mind, I invest in and develop innovative companies in Medtech, Digital Health, Biotech and Diagnostics.

Within the EQT Life Sciences Health Economic Funds we invest in innovative medtech, digital health and diagnostics startups that improve lives and quality of life while reducing health care costs.

Bio:
Prior to joining EQT Life Sciences (formerly LSP), Ruben led the Value-Based Care strategy for Philips where he also supported strategic deep dives and due diligence for investments. He represented Philips at Medtech Europe and led a World Economic Forum project.
 
Before, Ruben underwent surgical training in cardio-thoracic surgery with a special interest in interventional cardiology at the Erasmus University Medical Center. As part of this training, he also performed general and vascular surgery and worked at the intensive care. 
 
Ruben is a recognized expert in cost-effectiveness and health outcomes research, especially in coronary revascularization and structural heart interventions. He received a Fulbright Scholarship which he spent at the Mid-America Heart Institute in Kansas City to work on pivotal cardiovascular clinical trials. He has (co-)authored >40 articles in top peer-reviewed medical journals including JAMA, European Heart Journal, and the Journal of the American College of Cardiology, two chapters in the ESC Textbook of Cardiovascular Medicine and a European clinical guideline. Moreover, he was editorial board member at Eurointervention Journal and faculty at leading interventional cardiology and surgical societies EuroPCR and EACTS, from which he also received a young investigator award.
 
Ruben holds MD and PhD degrees from Erasmus Medical School in Rotterdam, a MSc in clinical research from NIHES and the Harvard School of Public Health, and a BSc in health economics from Erasmus School of Economics. Ruben lives in Amsterdam, in his spare time he is an sportsman and enjoys traveling.

skills: ['Bioinformatics', 'Genomics', 'Proteomics', 'Genetics', 'Sequencing', 'Microarray Analysis', 'Sequence Analysis', 'Molecular Biology', 'Cell Biology', 'Cell', 'Scientific Writing', 'Science', 'PCR', 'Immunology', 'Lifesciences', 'Protein Expression', 'Microbiology', 'Western Blotting', 'Protein-protein Interactions', 'Gene Expression Profiling']
summary:
I am a translational medical research scientist currently niched in infectious and cardiovascular diseases.  My daily delight is to unravel pathophysiological mechanisms of diseases from a molecular perspective that is purely informed by biological data and clinical evidence. As such, unveiling actionable diagnostics and therapeutic biomarkers, and deciphering drug side-effects from targeted molecular pathways is my call. 
I have both clinical and scientific work experience and am richly equipped with knowledge from the life sciences; the only way to make precision medicine, really precise. 

My first break from academics was to the clinic, where I put my knowledge in biochemistry, microbiology, parasitology, immunology and hematology, among others into practice, including direct interactions with patients. My second break from academics was to industry (bioinformatics, functional genomics, human genetics, drug testing, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, biostatistics, epidemiology and cardiology) in order to study the workflow and landscape of clinical trials, and squarely test the central dogma in systems biology. I enjoy working at the interface of science and the clinic, ensuring information fluxes to both directions by collaborating with both clinicians and scientists. I cherish international collaborations. 

In a little while, I'll be open for academic (professorship) positions in molecular cardiology and infection where I could provide scientific research support ( molecular mechanism of diseases, bioinformatics, biostatistics, grants and industrial liaison) and continue to supervise medical students on their BSc, MSc and PhD projects.

name: Medical Delta Cardiac Arrhythmia Lab
skills: ['cardiac mapping', 'Electrophysiology', 'Bioelectronics', 'Molecular Biology', 'Biotechnology', 'bioelectronics', 'clinical electrophysiology', 'molecular biology', 'Signal Processing', 'Biomedical Engineering']
summary:
The Medical Delta Cardiac Arrhythmia Lab is a network of excellent scientists from the Erasmus MC and TU Delft, including medical doctors, engineers, biologists, patients and companies working on innovative solutions for diagnosis and therapy of cardiac arrhythmias.

The four pillars of the Medical Delta Cardiac Arrhythmia Lab are governed by Prof.Dr. Natasja de Groot (Erasmus MC, chair), Prof. Dr. Bianca Brundel (VUmc), Prof. Dr. Alle-Jan vd Veen (TU Delft) and Prof. Dr. Wouter Serdijn (TU Delft).

Our ambition is to decrease the burden of cardiac arrhythmias by providing patient-tailored therapy targeting electropathology.

Our main goals are to: 
1)	design and test novel bio-electrical diagnostic tools
2)	unravel arrhythmia-related electropathology
3)	design and test novel therapies targeting electropathology

Our strategy to achieve these goals is to unravel and measure electropathology by: 
Pillar I: designing advanced (non-), (minimally)- invasive signal-recording techniques 	
Pillar II: designing advanced signal-processing techniques.
Pillar III: performing mapping studies in cell or tissue cultures, animal models and patients with various diseases.
Pillar IV: dissection of molecular pathways of structural remodelling underlying cardiac arrhythmias.

Examples of our expertise‚Äôs:
1. molecular biology underlying cardiac arrhythmias
2. embryological development of the heart
3. arrhythmia-on-a-chip development
4. cardiac mapping
5. clinical electrophysiology
6. cardiac surgery
5. bioelectronics 
6. circuits and systems: wearable, implantable active medical devices (transcutaneous wireless communication and autonomous design)
6. signal processing, array signal processing for speech, audio&acoustics, ultrasound/MRI imaging, wireless communication
7. big data 
8. artificial intelligence

The MC cardiac arrhythmia lab co-creates research with patient via the Atrial Fibrillation Innovation Platform. Follow AFIP!

https://afiponline.org 
http://bit.ly/2pkeM5N

summary: I am Associate Professor of Epidemiology and Principle Investigator of the Cardiometabolic Epidemiology research line of the population-based Rotterdam Study. My research is focused on epidemiology of cardio-metabolic disorders with an emphasis on gender differences. I study risk factor development and trajectories in atherosclerosis process. My studies mainly involve primary prevention of cardio-metabolic disorders; covering the course from an asymptomatic phase, to advent of sub-clinical disease, to overt disease. My research comprises both traditional and novel cardio-metabolic risk factors; including omics and markers representative of different pathophysiological pathways.

summary:
IMBridiging supports and guides organizations and healthcare companies by bridging the gap between their idea and the market and vice versa. Based on my broad knowledge of the market and customer, combined with the analysis of data and trends, I can make a good translation of customer needs into innovative products and the associated financial solutions. Defining the right product for the customer is the basis for successfully bringing the product to the market as the solution.  A solution that fits the needs of the mix of target groups: the patient, the healthcare provider and the healthcare insurer.


IMBridging wants to keep health care accessible and affordable

Good and affordable healthcare is one of the biggest topics of our time. The patient wants better access to care that suits his needs. The healthcare provider wants easy to use and effective tools to adequately treat the patient. The healthcare insurer wants to keep healthcare affordable and looks for cost-effective solutions. This requires innovative ideas in this very complex environment.


IMBridging works from practical experience

I have 35 years of experience in the global healthcare industry in the field of scientific research, marketing and business development. Worked on medical imaging in radiology, cardiology and oncology. In addition, many solutions introduced in the field of cardiology: interventional applications, physiological measurements and workflow improvements.
You can hire me as independent consultant or a employee

Specialties: Marketing, Medical Imaging and Cardiology, Business models based on circular economy (capital and operational expenses).

name: Pieter Vriesendorp
skills: ['Medicine', 'Medical Education', 'Clinical Research', 'Cardiology', 'Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy', 'Medical Research', 'Emergency Medicine', 'ICU', 'Clinical Trials', 'Critical Care', 'Medical Imaging']
summary:
Pieter Vriesendorp is an interventional cardiologist and medical director of the structural heart interventions at Maastricht UMC+ in the Netherlands.

After graduation from secondary school (Gymnasium, Theresialyceum, Tilburg), he was a teacher for one year at the Wauna Primary School, in the remote village of Wauna in Guyana; close to the Venezuelan border. In 2004 he started medical school at the Katholieke Universiteit Leuven in Belgium and graduated cum laude in 2011. He obtained his Doctor of Philosophy in 2016 under supervision of prof. Felix Zijlstra at Erasmus MC/Erasmus University Rotterdam, the Netherlands (Thesis title: Improving Outcomes in Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy). He completed his cardiology specialist training at the renowned Erasmus MC Thoraxcenter in Rotterdam, the Netherlands in March 2020. After his specialist training he completed a fellowship interventional and structural cardiology at The Alfred hospital in Melbourne, Australia under supervision of professor Tony Walton.

His research interests are hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, structural interventional cardiology and health economics. For the latter, he finished an executive master‚Äôs degree in Health Economics, Outcomes and Management at the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), London, United Kingdom in 2020, and graduated with distinction.

Outside of work, he is an avid traveler, loves backcountry skiing, diving, and surfing. He is engaged to Valerie Stockbroekx, and they live near Maastricht with their daughter Frederique.

name: Ernest Spitzer, MD

summary:
I am a cardiologist trained in Zaragoza, Spain, with focus on cardiovascular research. I joined Cardialysis, a world-renowned cardiovascular research organization based in Rotterdam, The Netherlands, in 2014, after having completed advanced training in cardiovascular imaging in Vienna, Austria, and a research fellowship in interventional cardiology in Bern, Switzerland. Since 2016, I have an academic affiliation with the Cardiology Department of the Erasmus University Medical Center. 

From Feb‚Äô20 until Aug‚Äô21, I served as Medical Director at Cardialysis, where my responsibilities included ensuring medical and clinical trial expertise in processes such as endpoint adjudication, data and safety monitoring boards, medical monitoring, safety reporting, trial design, and core lab processes, in close collaboration with operational and scientific experts. In September 2020, I was appointed Managing Director of the European Cardiovascular Research Institute (ECRI), a non-profit sister organization of Cardialysis, which facilitates the execution of multi-center, international, investigator-initiated, innovative cardiovascular clinical trials. Since September 2021, I served as Chief Medical Officer, and was appointed CEO in May 2023.

In March 2019, I became Board Member of the Academic Research Consortium, a collaborative platform among European and US-based Academic Research Organizations, and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, which brings international experts together to develop endpoint definitions and trial design principles, in cardiovascular research fields in need of standardization.

I graduated summa cum laude in 2005 from the Catholic University of Saint Mary, Arequipa, Peru, and served two years at the Peruvian Armed Forces. I completed my cardiology training at the University Hospital Miguel Servet, Zaragoza, Spain. I was awarded a research fellowship by the European Association of Percutaneous Cardiovascular Interventions of the European Society of Cardiology and a research fellowship by the Spanish Society of Cardiology. In 2014, I completed a 4-year master program in statistics and research methodology at the Autonomous University of Barcelona. I have contributed with 60+ articles in peer-reviewed journals.

name: J. Wouter Jukema
summary:
Professor J. Wouter Jukema, MD, PhD, FESC, FACC, is chair of the Dept. of Cardiology, and past "Established Clinical Investigator of the Netherlands Heart Foundation, Leiden University Medical Center (LUMC) in the Netherlands.  He received his medical degree from the Free University School of Medicine in Amsterdam and completed his training at the LUMC.  He is also founding director of the Durrer Center for Cardiogenetic Research in Amsterdam as well as co-chairman of the Netherlands Heart Institute in Utrecht the Netherlands (NLHI) 

He started his research with the conduction of the Angiographic Coronary Atherosclerosis Trial ‚ÄúREGRESS‚Äù, at the Netherlands Heart Institute in Utrecht.  
Nowadays his interests, which comprise the majority of topics for his >1000 peer reviewed publications focus on the field of athero-thrombosis and include interventional cardiology as well as atherosclerosis research (vascular biology, lipids, diabetes and genetics) in humans and in transgenic animals. 
Prof. Jukema is principal investigator in several interventional/athero-thrombosis studies, a member of various national and international athero-thrombosis boards and holder of multiple major (a.o. EU) grants.

name: B. Daan Westenbrink
skills: ['ICD implantation', 'Wetenschap', 'Beeldvormend medisch onderzoek', 'Hart- en vaatziekte', 'Klinisch onderzoek', 'Metabolisme', 'Klinische farmacologie']
summary:
Dr. Westenbrink is a cardiologist and a translational scientist who, previous to his current appointment, completed a PhD program at the University of Groningen and a post-doctoral fellowship at the University of California San Diego, USA. He is registered as a clinical pharmacologist and subspecializes in heart failure and cardiac MRI.

His research group consists of (clinical) research fellows, MD/PhD students and master students from different nationalities and backgrounds working on new ways to recharge the failing heart. His research focus is translational in nature and includes fundamental studies to unravel the root cause of myocardial energy deficiency in heart failure as well as clinical trials testing new strategies to improve energy delivery to the heart. Dr. Westenbrink has received several research grants from the Netherlands Heart Foundation (junior and senior clinical scientist), the Dutch Organization for Scientific Research (AGIKO and VENI) and the European Society of Cardiology and his work has received several international awards. He has served as Associate Editor for the European Journal of Heart Failure and as chair of Young@Heart, the talent development council of the Dutch Cardiovascular Alliance (DCVA).

Current activities:

His research group studies the origins of mitochondrial dysfunction in heart failure with the intention to develop metabolic therapies for this condition. The research involves functional studies in isolated mitochondria and cultured cardiomyocytes as well as intervention studies in murine models. Clinical research employs advanced MRI techniques to study the role of myocardial adiposity in the pathophysiology of HFpEF and to test the effect of ketone bodies on cardiac metabolism. Dr. Westenbrink is also a principal investigator of the DCVA consortium DOUBLE DOSIS and a member of the Dutch working group on cardiac metabolism. He is currently working as the director of the cardiology clinic and serves as an editor of the Netherlands Heart journal.

summary:
"Most important of all, I feel blessed improving the health of my patients, and bringing joy to them and their loved ones. I'm proud to be an integral part of the cardiology programme of Isala, including high level patient care, scientific research, education and medical innovation" 

Dr. Ahmet Adiyaman (1981, Doetinchem, the Netherlands) is a cardiologist specialized in state-of-the art cardiac electrophysiology, hypertensive heart disease, and cardiac pacing/ICD. He is PhD (2009), with prof.dr. J.A. Staessen (KU Leuven, Belgium) and prof.dr. T. Thien (Radboud UMC, Nijmegen, the Netherlands) as promotors.

Expertise in EP
Dr. Adiyaman is expert in invasive cardiac electrophysiology and cardiac pacing (EHRA certified 2014). He is an experienced operator for pacemakers, ICD, CRT and Left bundle branch/His pacing (>1500 procedures), and electrophysiology (>2000 procedures), including ablation of typical and atypical atrial flutters, atrial tachycardias, AVNRT, accessory pathways, complex AF and endo/epicardial VT/VF ablation (cardiomyopathies, Brugada syndrome, idiopathic VF). 

Expertise in CVRM/hypertension 
Cardiovascular risk management, measurement of arterial stiffness and treatment of resistant hypertension (incl. renal denervation).¬† 

Innovation 
With his team, dr. Adiyaman contributed to: 
- state-of-the-art developments in invasive cardiac EP and pacing/devices
- renal nerve stimulation guided denervation in treating hypertension
- treatment of intermediate high risk pulmonary embolism and development of a PE response team
- electroanatomically guided myocardial biopsy programme in diagnosis and risk stratification (Sarcoidosis or other cardiomyopathies).
- projects shaping cost effective healthcare, E-health, home- and telemonitoring, online pati√´nt education and support. 

Partial transition of healthcare to home and non-hospital environments, preserving top level patient friendly healthcare, is one of his goals.

Science
Active contribution to the design of trials, and subsequent drafting and publication of articles, with 85 publications at present and H-index of 22.

Education 
Isala is an EHRA certified training centre for cardiac electrophysiology, and dr. Adiyaman is associate director of the fellowship programme. Lecturer in cardiovascular medicine for students, residents/fellows, and cardiologists.

Clinical cardiology
General cardiology, cardiac intensive care and imaging (SPECT/PET, CT, MRI, echocardiography).

Management 
Partner (2016) and board member (2019-2021) of the cardiology dept.

name: Dick Thijssen
position 2: Professor of Cardiovascular Physiology and Exercise
summary: My work aims to understand the impact of exercise training and physical (in)activity in the context of (primary and secondary) prevention of cardiovascular disease. For this purpose, I adopt novel imaging approaches to assess the effects of exercise training on micro and macrovessel function and structure, and explore factors that moderate these effects (e.g. older age). These benefits of exercise training on the arterial wall may contribute to the reduction in cardiovascular risk. Furthermore, my work has strongly focused on understanding (hemodynamic) stimuli, such as shear stress and arterial pressure, to mediate the effects of exercise training on the vasculature. In my work I encompasses the lifespan; from exercise training in the prevention of the development of atherosclerosis in obese children and adolescents, to research on the best combination of exercise and (non)pharmacological strategies in the management of patients with cardiovascular risk and/or disease.

name: Rianne (Frederika A) Vermeij-van Nimwegen
skills: ['Epidemiology', 'Cancer', 'Research', 'Biostatistics', 'Public Health', 'Infectious Diseases', 'Science', 'Life Sciences', 'Large-scale Data Analysis', 'Databases', 'Scientific Writing', 'Multivariate Statistics', 'Questionnaire Design', 'GCP', 'Data Management']
summary:
I am Rianne Vermeij-van Nimwegen, a driven and enthusiastic epidemiologist with a broad interest in several health-related topics. Teamwork, decision making, pharmacovigilance, data analysis, clinical trial design and regulation, communication and advisory make me enthusiastic.

Currently, I work at P95 as senior epidemiologist, mainly on COVIDRIVE, a public-private consortium. COVIDRIVE was set-up to study vaccine effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccines in Europa. Currently, we are exploring the possibilities to expand the COVIDRIVE scope to other respiratory pathogens to become a large and sustainable research platform for infectious respiratory diseases in Europe.

From 2015 to 2022, I worked as a pharmacovigilance assessor at the Dutch Medicines Evaluation Board (CBG-MEB), assessing drug safety of new and marketed drugs. 

In 2016, I completed my PhD-project, which focused on the long-term risks of cardiovascular diseases after Hodgkin lymphoma treatment at The Netherlands Cancer Institute. Besides oncology and cardiology I have worked on projects including diabetes mellitus, allergies and infectious diseases. 

Specialties: Epidemiology, Oncology, Cardiology, Pharmacovigilance, Drug Safety, Infectious Diseases, Diabetes, Allergies, cohort studies, case-control studies, data management, scientific writing, project management, big data analyses

name: Kim van der Heiden
skills: ['Cell Biology', 'Molecular Biology', 'Immunohistochemistry', 'Lifesciences', 'Confocal Microscopy', 'Science', 'Cell Culture', 'Cell']
summary:
Kim van der Heiden is a vascular biologist, who aims to discover new treatment and/or diagnostic imaging targets for cardiovascular diseases by unravelling the interplay between cells, the extracellular matrix and their mechanical environment. In this regards, she makes use of tissue engineered human disease models in a physiologically relevant mechanical environment, suitable for live imaging and mechanical testing. 
Her multidisciplinary projects bring together biologists, engineers, imagers and clinicians, using pre-clinical, ex vivo and in vitro models to study mechanopathology in cardiovascular diseases, including atherosclerotic plaque rupture and vein graft failure. 

She studied Biomedical Sciences at VU University of Amsterdam and obtained her PhD degree in 2008 from the University of Leiden. She performed postdoctoral research at Imperial College London and at Erasmus MC. In 2010, she was awarded an NWO-Veni grant, in 2012 an Erasmus MC Fellowship grant, in 2014 a Dutch Heart Foundation Dekker Senior Postdoc grant, and in 2020 an NWO-Vidi grant. In 2021, she became associate professor in mechanopathology at the department of Biomedical Engineering, Erasmus MC.

name: Leon De Windt
skills: ['Animal Models', 'Molecular Biology', 'Science', 'Bioinformatics', 'Lifesciences', 'Cell Biology', 'Genetics', 'Cell Culture', 'Laboratory', 'In Vivo', 'Translational Medicine', 'Physiology', 'Biochemistry', 'Protein Expression', 'Life Sciences', 'In Vitro', 'Immunohistochemistry', 'Cardiovascular Disease']
summary:
Leon de Windt is professor of Molecular Cardiovascular Biology and runs the Department of Molecular Genetics at Maastricht University in The Netherlands.

He obtained a Master‚Äôs degree in Molecular Biology and Biochemistry at Utrecht University in 1994 and a PhD in Cardiovascular Physiology at Maastricht University in 1999. Following a postdoctoral residence at the Howard Hughes Medical Institute of prof. dr. Jeffery Molkentin in Cincinnati OH, USA where he studied signal transduction in cardiac remodeling, he became group leader at the Hubrecht Institute in Utrecht, The Netherlands. In 2010 he was appointed as professor of Molecular Cardiovascular Biology at Maastricht University in The Netherlands, where he currently chairs a department. His research focuses on the function of non-coding RNAs as regulators of cardiac gene expression using genetic manipulation in (iPS-derived) cardiomyocytes and mouse models of heart disease, exploiting their academic findings towards rational therapy development for genetic and acquired forms of heart failure.

He is the recipient of several awards, including the VENI (2001), VIDI (2007) and VICI (2017) career development awards from the Dutch Research Council (NWO); the 2021 Outstanding Achievement Award of the ESC Council for Basic Cardiovascular Science and the 2012 Galenus Research Prize. He is the recipient of an ERC Consolidator Grant from the European Research Council, coordinates the Dutch CardioVascular Alliance (DCVA) ARENA-PRIME consortium aimed to tackle inherited heart diseases and in 2019 became coordinator of the Marie Curie ITN consortium TRAIN-HEART focusing on regenerative approaches for ischemic heart disease. Many alumni from his group have successfully started their own research laboratories, fulfill executive industrial functions or became clinician-researchers as the future generation of leaders in medicine.

summary:
I am passionate and dedicated to supporting medical and scientific projects that drive healthcare forward and provide patient treatment options. 

I have successfully revealed pathological mechanisms underlying several acquired and inherited heart diseases and identified regulators that serve as promising drugable candidates for future therapeutic strategies during my PhD training. My specialties are cardiovascular diseases, omics data, project management, presentation skills, communications, team player, flexibility, solution-focused thinking, and creativity.

summary:
Department of Paediatric Cardiology, Emma Children‚Äôs Hospital/ Academic Medical Centre, University of Amsterdam and integral part of the Centre for Congenital Heart Disease Amsterdam/Leiden (CAHAL). 
Head of fetal cardiology CAHAL: Centre for Congenital Heart Defects Amsterdam-Leiden. 
I am currently active in all spheres of paediatric cardiology with a special interest in prenatal diagnosis, and (inherited) arrhythmias. 
My work includes echocardiography, prenatal diagnosis (echocardiography, diagnosis and counseling), management of patients and fetuses with rhythm disturbances, and supervision of cardiac patients admitted to the wards and to the Paediatric and Neonatal Intensive Care Units. 
I supervise and teach the paediatric cardiology fellows and participate in the refresher courses for paediatricians and teach the junior staff and students. Research topics include the increased nuchal translucency and fetal heart failure and fetal congenital heart defects, fetal arrhythmias, inheritable chanalopathies (Long QT Syndrome etc) and Rheumatic Fever. I supervise students doing their research block and bachelor thesis and am/have been the co-promotor of PhD theses on inheritable arrhythmia syndromes. 
I have been an invited speaker at international conferences, review journal articles for international journals, have opposed at PhD defences and have frequently presented posters and oral communications internationally.
I am also a mother of two lovely boys and enjoy painting, karate and playing the clarinet.

summary: Thijs Eijsvogels is trained in exercise physiology at the Radboud University (PhD degree, NL), Hartford Hospital (postdoc, USA) and Liverpool John Moores University (postdoc, UK). Thijs is interested in the physiological and cardiac responses of the human body to acute and chronic (endurance) exercise performance. His research is focused on the benefits and potential deleterious effects of exercise across the whole spectrum of physical activity: from inactivity to excessive volumes of exercise. Thijs‚Äô work combines the fields of physiology, cardiology and epidemiology and studies are performed in the general population, cardiovascular patients and athletes. His ultimate goal is to find the sweet spot for exercise.

skills: ['Clinical Research', 'Medicine', 'Cardiology', 'Hospitals', 'ICU', 'Research', 'Medical Education', 'Healthcare', 'Medical Imaging', 'Emergency Medicine', 'Medical Research', 'Epidemiology']
summary: Ivo Henkens was born April 29th 1977 in Leiderdorp, the Netherlands. After his Gymnasium diploma from the St. Bonifatius College in Utrecht in 1995, he traded Dutch soil for a horizon-broadening year of undergraduate study at Wittenberg University, in Springfield, Ohio, USA. He was inspired to study Biomedical Science, and enrolled in 1996 at the Leiden University. In the same year he joined the Leiden Student Union Minerva. However, the idea of interaction with patients appealed to him so much, that after finishing his freshmen year he started studying Medicine. After a successful first year, he joined the ‚ÄúJoshua‚Äôs‚Äù, a group of students, involved in post-operative patient care at the thoracic intensive care unit of the Leiden University Hospital. His first scientific research project was a spin-off of this work, and inspired him to persevere in research in parallel to his clinical work. He finished his clinical studies with an internship at the department of Cardiology at the Leiden University Medical Center. After his medical degree in 2004 he started his PhD-research in January 2005 at this same department under supervision of Dr. H.W. Vliegen, Professor M.J. Schalij and Professor E.E. van der Wall. During the following three years and three months, of which the thesis "non-invasive diagnosis and follow-up of right ventricular overload" is the result, he has worked hard to setup the multidisciplinary Leiden University Medical Center ‚Äúpulmonary hypertension working group‚Äù. Regarding the pulmonary hypertension research he has worked in close cooperation with Dr. A. Vonk Noordegraaf, Dr. A. Boonstra, and K.T.B. Mouchaers of the VU University Medical Center. Since July 1st 2014 he is active as a Cardiologist, currently in the Bravis hospital in Roosendaal/Bergen op Zoom, with special attention for transthoracic echocardiography (ESC certified 2014) and cardiac device therapy (EHRA exam 2013).

skills: ['Epidemiology', 'Lifesciences', 'Clinical Research', 'Medicine', 'Scientific Writing', 'English', 'Science', 'Public Health', 'Biotechnology', 'Medical Research', 'Data Analysis', 'Health Economics', 'Global Health', 'Biostatistics', 'Cancer', 'SPSS', 'Healthcare', 'Genetics', 'Genomics', 'Molecular Biology']
summary: Diederick (Rick) Grobbee has been a (principal) investigator in many large scale epidemiologic studies and randomized trials of interventions for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. His experience covers the full range of epidemiologic study designs including trials, cohorts and case-control studies. Topics include hypertension, diabetes, risk factors in children and youngsters, coronary heart disease, women‚Äôs health, cardiovascular aging, heart failure and non-invasive vascular imaging. In addition to research on drugs he examined the cardiovascular effects of various nutrients and dietary factors in cohort studies and trials. Apart from his interest in cardiovascular disease he has worked on the theoretical principles and methods of diagnostic and prognostic research.  In 1996 he established the Julius Center at the University Medical Center Utrecht of which he served as a principal director for allmost 15 years. More recently he initiated a global platform for educational exchange, (www.elevatehealth.eu) of which he served as the non-executive director and chair until 2019. In 2011 he started a unit for research on Global Health, a summary of activities is given at www.globalhealth.eu.. He acts as Chief Scientific Officer and statutory director at Julius Clinical Ltd. An Academic Contract Organization established in 2008 as a spin-off of the University Medical Center Utrecht (www.juliusclinical.com). Rick Grobbee was listed in the top 100 global most influential biomedical researchers (Eur J Clin Invest. 2013 Dec;43(12):1339-65). His views on Clinical Epidemiology can be found in Grobbee & Hoes, Clinical Epidemiology (http://www.jblearning.com/catalog/9781449674328/). Rick Grobbee serves on the board of the European Society of Cardiology and chairs its Global Affairs Committee. Rick Grobbee is a fellow of the Royal Dutch Academy of Sciences. He currently acts as the Editor-in-Chief of Global Heart (https://globalheartjournal.com/) the official Journal of the World Heart Federation of which he serves on the board. He supervised over 150 PhD fellows and published more than 1300 scientific papers, chapters and books. Number of international citations (Web of Science) 93,315. Hirsch: h = 163. Google Scolar h = 214. In 2017 he was knighted by the Dutch King (Knight in the Order of the Dutch Lion).

skills: ['Amusement', 'Marketing', 'Kunst', 'Communicatie', 'Promotie', 'Strategie', 'Ondernemerschap', 'Bereik', 'Dans', 'Mensen aansturen']
summary:
As an author and creator, I consider my art an expression of my passion and a form of self therapy. I took a Journey through art and expression and am finally ready to share it with the world. I radically changed careers and started living from my heart.
Allow me to reintroduce myself:
My values Empowerment, Truthfulness, and Innovation are reflected in everything I do.

The Culture
One of my life goals is to awaken people through my projects, productions, art and books. 
I want to do more than just inspire and educate, I want to elevate the entire culture.
I am humbly on the forefront of the Afrofuturism Movement in Europe, touring major museums and venues across Europe, promoting the culture, artists and history with my media productions & virtual art expos.
One of my latest creations is a unique universe of sci-fi, adventure, history, magical realism, African and world mythology that I express through literature, animation, creative technology, and music.

The Institute
I co-founded First Noble, Europe‚Äôs first institute for World History and Afro-Caribbean Arts & Culture, where like-minded artists, creators, and students come together to create. It is a platform and stepping stone allowing them to connect and grow within an international community. Using my experience and expertise, I also advise and guide underprivileged and upcoming artists. Helping others to succeed is a crucial pillar in everything I do. 

The Book
My first book, HIS STORY OF THE WORLD, L‚Äô HISTOIRE DU MONDE  is a vortex into an exciting and new multiverse where african legends and mythology meets reality. Travelling through time and space, you will find ancient civilizations, people with magical powers and discover the true origin of myths and legends. You will learn about events that shaped our reality and the world as we know it. It bears ancient knowledge and a hidden truth about our human history.
After reading this book, which is Part One of a series, you will never look at our world and the universe the same again.

I am available for speaking engagements, book readings and signings. 
Feel free to contact me for talks or collabs on: Creative technology (VR, Motion capturing and animation), Afrofuturism, Performing Arts, Media, Digital Art, Afro Caribbean Heritage & Mythology and Youth Culture. 

www.hisstoryoftheworld.com
www.firstnoble.org

name: Kimberley Jazwa-van den Berg

summary:
Recent PhD with 15+ years of experience in managing, analyzing, and presenting scientific information. Educator with a passion for research education & archaeology.

At the moment, I am working as a lecturer in Research Skills at the Denturism program of HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht. In addition, I am the editorial secretary for Pharos - Journal of the Netherlands Institute at Athens. Besides higher ed and journal editing, my interests are research data management, social media, science communication, cultural marketing, fundraising, and heritage management. 

Since July 2016, I have been combining several of these interests in my role as Social Media Manager and Content Writer for Brewing Classical Styles, a (currently dormant) blog that manages and analyzes data on the role of beer in ancient Greece and Rome and communicates these to specialists and the wider public.   

My dissertation research examined the connections between the Aegean and Italy during the Bronze Age-Iron Age transition (ca. 1250 ‚Äì 1000 BC). During my time as a PhD researcher, I presented my work at a number of international conferences and was involved in organizing one myself. I also taught guest lectures at both BA and MA levels. In addition, throughout my studies (BA, MA, PhD) I have worked on a number of archaeological projects in the Netherlands, Italy, Greece, and the US. Over the last few years, I have been particularly involved in post-excavation activities, such as storeroom management, artifact cataloging, and data entry. 

Contact information: kamvandenberg@gmail.com

summary:
Januari 2017 heb ik vanuit passie, opleiding en ervaring LaLoba.nl opgericht. Ik help jou makkelijker te bewegen door op een vriendelijke manier de verbinding te herstellen tussen je lijf en je brein. Zo leer je ook de in je hersenen opgeslagen pijn los te laten. name: Patrick Koster
skills: ['Visual Arts', 'Martial Arts', 'Community Development', 'Kunst', 'Schone kunsten', 'Performing Arts', 'Shotokan Karate', 'Positive Energy', 'Empowerment', 'Health Club Management']
summary:
Inspired by the time and world we live in, Patrick Koster intervenes artistically by placing 'the evil' in an alienating context. His work ensures that your mind does not immediately see through the struggle and violence in the image, but that you use your imagination to fathom it. "In my work I explore the violence and ideas of attackers. In many cases there is hardly any contradiction between reasonable thinking and evil. Reason is an instrument that can be used for good and for evil. Thinking too can easily turn from good to evil. "
.
What does struggle mean for Patrick? "Studying evil and violence has always been a field of the arts. Think of Francisco Goya's painting 'Saturn that swallows up his children', Dantes Hell, Medea from Greek mythology, Van den Vos Reynaerde, Macbeth, The Joker or Hanibal Lecter. It stiltens our fascination with violence, our desire to witness the cross-border, the covert, the forbidden, the gruesome. Art can produce an interval between seeing and understanding, creating a question mark in the midst of the flood of images. Creating a sort of space so that the thinking no longer reproduces the already established opinions and new thoughts can start. To release such an intermediate area, the artist will have to undermine the stereotyped images and thought patterns. Sand in the representation machine so that it falters and jerks and no longer conjures up the calibrated image. None of the contradictions with which we have classified our world is still to be trusted. The beauty no longer belongs to the good, the ugly no longer automatically to evil. "

name: Marietje Kardaun
skills: ['Teaching', 'Editing', 'Academic Writing', 'Lecturing', 'University Teaching', 'Social Sciences', 'History', 'Research', 'Theory', 'Art', 'Psychology', 'Publishing', 'Qualitative Research', 'Higher Education', 'Literature', 'English', 'Dutch', 'Public Speaking', 'German', 'Writing']
summary:
Marietje Kardaun (Maria Kardaun) is a senior lecturer at the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences, Maastricht University, The Netherlands. She is in the Board of Editors of PSYART, a Hyperlink Journal for the Psychological Study of the Arts, member of the Netherlands Research School for Literary Studies, member of the Turmgruppe f√ºr Jung'sche Psychologie Z√ºrich, and member of the Asociaci√≥n de Psicolog√≠a Anal√≠tica de Valencia. Studied Latin and Greek at Leiden University (1987, cum laude). Gained PhD in 1993 with a psychoanalytic (Freudian) interpretation of Petronius' Satyricon. Wrote a monograph on the concept of ‚Äòmimesis‚Äô in Greek philosophy for the Koninklijke Nederlandse Academie van Wetenschappen (Der Mimesisbegriff in der griechischen Antike, North-Holland 1993), and many articles of mainly Jungian literary criticism. Together with her colleague Joke Spruyt she edited The Winged Chariot: Collected Essays on Plato & Platonism in Honour of L.M. de Rijk, Leiden etc.: Brill 2000 (= Brill‚Äôs Studies in Intellectual History, vol. 100). In 2011 she published Fighting the Angel: Biblical and Mythical Encounters with Demons and Deities. Roskilde: EyeCorner (https://www.eyecorner.press/books/fighting-the-angel). Recurring themes in her work are: theoretical aspects of literary criticism; mythology; philosophy of art; Platonism; Romantic German poetry (Goethe, Herder, Eichendorff); depth psychological Bible interpretation; dreams in mythology and religion.
Marietje grew up in Overijssel, an eastern part of Holland. She is married to Jhr. Mr. Dr. Guus R√∂ell, who started his career as an ethologist at the University of Groningen, subsequently worked as a criminologist at the University of Leiden and later at the Dutch Ministry of Justice in the Hague, and who is now an antiques dealer who specializes in Dutch colonial furniture (www.guusroell.com). Together with their son August (1998) and their heavily spotted stray dog Esau (2010) they live in Maastricht.

summary:
Docent wereldgeschiedenis en oude geschiedenis aan de Universiteit Utrecht. Ik onderzoek culturele en religieuze uitwisselingen in Afro-Euraziatische imperia, met name in de Perzische en Hellenistische periodes (ca. 5e-1e eeuw v.C.). Daarnaast hou ik mij bezig met het moderne beeld van de Oudheid en het westerse beeld van de "Ori√´nt". 

Ik geef regelmatig publiekslezingen in Nederland en Belgi√´, en begeleid (kunst)historische reizen naar Mediterrane bestemmingen. U kunt mij boeken als Oudheid-deskundige en voor lezingen over onder meer de Zijderoute, Cleopatra, Alexander de Grote, het oude Perzi√´, klassieke mythologie, Istanbul en het Osmaanse Rijk. 

I teach World History and Ancient History at the University of Utrecht. I am a former Getty Scholar at the Getty Research Institute and Villa, and previously worked at the University of California in Los Angeles, and the University of Leiden. My research concerns Eurasian empires in a comparative perspective, focusing on monarchy, court culture and cultural interactions in the Persian and Hellenistic periods. My field of expertise also includes ancient religion and mythology, the history and topography of Istanbul, western views of the "Orient", and the use of the classical past in modern contexts.

name: Anna Tananyan
skills: ['Illustrator', 'composition', 'Great Colors', 'miniatuur', 'Decoration', 'simbolic', 'Painting', 'Figurative Art', 'Fine Art', 'Contemporary Art', 'Oil Painting', 'Modern Art', 'Public Art', 'Pointillisme', 'Ornament', 'Collage', 'Drawing', 'decadentisme', 'estheticisme', 'jugendstil']
summary:
Anna Tananyan is an artist of Armenian descent living in Laren, in the center of Holland. She received her art education at the Academy of Arts in Yerevan, Armenia. 

Painting 
Her powerful artwork contains many classic and mythic themes and some features of traditional symbolism. In her separate paintings the effect of her powerful use of colors changes, but is harmonious and challenging each and every time, sometimes even on the edge of psychedelics. Sometimes they do, therefore, remind us of the flower power movement of the sixties. 
However, they also contain many parallels with the romantic works of Symbolist artists of the fin de si√®cle, such as the Dutch painter Toorop and the Russian born Kandinsky. By the way, she herself said to have been influenced by the Jugendstylartists Gustav Klimt and Antoni Gaud√≠, which is no surprise once one has seen her work. Her preference for decorative ornaments and symbols seem to have been rooted in her younger years. She used to wove rugs and tapestries and make collages when she was younger. No wonder that the continuous alternation of contrasting colors and patterns have inspired the baroque and decorative aspect that characterizes her work today.

Graphic work 
In addition to her paintings, she also makes pen drawings and watercolors, or a combination of those two. Her graphic work is very detailed, colorful, graceful and magical, and clearly inspired by fashion, clothing and jewelry design. More specific, the elegant female figures from the fin-de-si√®cle, and rich ornamental art and craft patterns from the Caucasus and other ethnic art, such as the Slavic folklore and mythology, French pointillism, Armenian / Mediterranean miniatures, Indonesian batik, Japanese and Egyptian papyri ukiyos do belong to her references. Her graphic work has the expressive, decorative and colorful character very suitable for posters and book illustrations.

name: John Haanstra
summary:
Parallax Art Fair (Londen, UK)
London May 16-18 2012

If you want to view my paintings at this Art Fair then please inform me.

Parallax Art Fair (Londen, UK)
Parallax AF grew out of an international exhibition called ‚ÄúParallax‚Äù that was conceived and curated by the art historian and theorist Dr Chris Barlow.
Parallax AF is different from other artists‚Äô fairs in that it is like a specialised exhibition.
It is a serious platform for international and national artists to present their work to national and international dealers, art industry people, collectors, critics and buyers without commission charges.


John Haanstra offers selective collections of original paintings to art lovers and art buyers. At his website you can mainly see artworks which fall in the category of surrealism. Besides surrealism there are also paintings available in the category of impressionism. 

He started his journey by applying elements of Greek mythology and surrealism. Central in this collection (Connecting Time) is the use of surrealistic factors. He advanced his way through the elements of fantastic realism and magic realism shown in the second collection (Circle of Tales) and the third collection (City Life). The latest works partly step away from the "magic surrealistic world" into a more impressionistic world. 

In spite of the application of several art styles in his collections, John Haanstra follows a clear line with his artworks. The paintings of John Haanstra can be recognized by settings in which everything is in balance. He combines various elements into his paintings to portray the stories behind the works. In fact, it can be said that John Haanstra directs with paint. 

Paintings can be bought by contacting the artist by phone or mail. It will be appreciated if Art lovers leave there feedback by mail. These modern oil paintings can be seen in my atelier in the Netherlands. Watch the collections of surrealism and impressionism and enjoy my Gallery!

Specialties: These artworks are painted with oil paint on canvas using fine brush strokes. This method of painting requires a highly skilled technique and a particular feeling for composition. Several old and new painting techniques are used to create these paintings. These qualities make John Haanstra's paintings particularly unique.

field of studies 1: Master of Arts in Arts and Culture: Artistic Research
skills: ['Photoshop', 'InDesign', 'Microsoft Office', 'Mac OS X', 'Photography', 'Photo Editing', 'Digital Photography', 'Fashion Photography', 'Art', 'Creative Writing', 'Social Media', 'Image Editing', 'Fashion', 'Fine Art Photography', 'Commercial Photography', 'Photos', 'Portrait Photography', 'Portraits']
summary:
An Amsterdam-based artist from the West Indies, specialized in directing and producing visual concepts for fashion films and photographic production.

Lisandro Suriel earned his Bachelor's degree in Photography at the Royal Academy of Art in The Hague and received his Master's of Art by research in Artistic Research and Art Studies at the University of Amsterdam.  As part of his Master's thesis he analyzed early twentieth century illustrations of West-Indian mythology in relation to cultural aphasia. This research forms the foundation of his ongoing artistic project that works to resurrect the forgotten ghosts of identity hidden deep within Caribbean lore.  

Currently his work explores the boundaries between fashion, photography, theater and illustration. Lisandro creates concepts and visually executes them, whether it be forging stellar systems in a fishbowl or bringing a Martian sunset to the Dutch coastline.

Specialties: Photographic and Film Direction and Production

www.lisandrosuriel.com 

e-mail him personally at :  lisandrosuriel@gmail.com


"My main concern is: What role does the imagery play in today‚Äôs society, and how do we relate to it? In my artistic work I constantly analyze what it means to be human and where the medium of photography acts as a station of the imaginary feeding sapient reality. Despite our never-ending technological advances and evolution of understanding, the core of what it means to be human remains in absolute stasis manifested in an ingenuous state of wonder."    

 -  Reflections in Astronomical Phenomena: An anecdotal essay exploring the parameters of reality perception. Bachelor's Thesis Lisandro Suriel. -

name: Justin Pate
skills: ['Advertising', 'Vehicle Graphics', 'Graphics', 'Training', 'Wraps', 'Outdoor Advertising', 'Video', 'Art', 'Time Management', 'Signs', 'Marketing Strategy', 'Marketing', 'Business Development', 'Sales', 'Trade Shows', 'Video Production', 'Video Editing', 'Hands-on Training']
summary:
I am owner of The Wrap Institute and head trainer for Avery Dennison North America.  I am an American who has been based out of Amsterdam since 2007.  I began my wrapping career as a freelance installer in New York City in 1996.  During this time I wrapped around 2000 vehicles along with walls, windows and floors.  After moving to Amsterdam, I came out with my first instructional DVD called Techniques and Tips: Vehicle Graphic Installations.  The next year I came out with 2 more DVDs and began teaching hands on workshops. In Europe I taught workshops for 3M and in the United States I started teaching workshops for Mutoh.  In 2010 I started the Avery Dennison  North American hands-on workshop program and in 2013 added an advanced course as well as a certification program.   As of 2020, I teach hands-on workshps for Avery Dennison North America, Japan, Australia and South Africa along with Alltak Tuning in Brazil.  I also have been a judge in numerous wrap competitions, notably FESPA Wrap Masters, Cambea wrap contest in Brazil and the Irish Wrap Championships.  Since 2014 I have also had the good fortune to coordinate, install and mc the Avery Dennison SEMA booth which has included some legendary installs and designs with fellow wrappers: Jim Miller, Joffrey van der Jagt, John Duever and Chad Parrish.  

In 2014, I launched The Wrap Institute with my partner Scott Bechtel, owner of Car Wrap City in Dallas.  The Wrap Insitute is an online streaming video platform that started out with 80 instructional videos and  6 years later has over 2000 videos and counting.   The Wrap Insitute is a neutral platform which means that all content is soley based on how to wrap with no agenda other than creating the highest quality, durability and efficiency.  The Wrap Institute now has facilities in Dallas and Munich and offers a wide variety of services: training videos, product and promotional videos, hands-on training and consultation.  Since 2015 The Wrap Institute has had a central booth at the Wrapscon show for NBM with the focus on bringing awareness to the wrap industry.  In 2019, The Wrap Institute partnered with ISA on a multi-tier platform.  The first is a wrap contest called The Never Stop Learning Wrap Contest.  This is an event open to all levels of installers.  We also have created The Wrap Experience which is an innovative learning area for attendees at the show.   The Wrap Institute and ISA have also created a digital badge program for installers.

skills: ['Graphic Design', 'Art', 'Music', 'Creative Direction', 'Photography', 'Web Design', 'Photoshop', 'Social Media', 'Advertising', 'Music Production', 'HORECA', 'Dance', 'Editing', 'Art Direction', 'Film', 'Event Management', 'English', 'Digital Photography', 'Copywriting', 'Adobe Creative Suite']
summary:
Short CV: Monique van Kerkhof has returned to the Netherlands, Maastricht, since 2012, after living abroad most of her life. She worked as a cultural entrepreneur and in visual/performing arts in cities as Barcelona, New York and Tokyo, She created projects in Egypt, Tunisia, Macedonia and West Africa.
Monique started her own company MONDESIGN as a cultural entrepreneur and in visual and performing arts in Tokyo since 2002.
Born in Nijmegen, Holland. Most of her youth she lived in Maastricht, she moved to Amsterdam at an age of 17 and got involved in Modern Dance. She left for Spain, when 22 years old to study Spanish and continuing dancing in Barcelona at ‚ÄòLa Fabrica‚Äô. In 1985 she moved to New York City studying at the ‚ÄòAlvin Nikolais Dance School‚Äô and at  the ‚ÄòMerce Cunningham Studio‚Äô (She received a scholarship from Merce Cunningham)

PRESS RELEASE
During the Realtime International Film Festival in Lagos, Nigeria, a production by the Dutch artist Monique van Kerkhof in the category of music films was voted the best.
The short film "Follow Me Down Again" by Monique van Kerkhof is an adaptation of dance fragments and street recordings. Most of them were recorded during the dress rehearsal for a spectacular dance performance during the museum night in 2016 in Bookstore Dominicanen. The film was produced last year 2018.and 2 winning prizes have been awarded in Bombay as "award winner of best film director and best film". In addition, her film team received five nominations. Her film has been nominated 30 times so far, including Hollywood New Directors Film Festival in London, Amsterdam and Moscow. 
Monique van Kerkhof has developed into a multidisciplinary artist. In addition to choreography, she is also involved with film, music, dance, theater, installations, graphic design and product design in which an impressive oeuvre has been built up.
Her dance performance and short film "Follow Me Down Again" are inspired by the mythology of Icarus. About life enthusiasm and risk; trial and error whereby a connection is made with the quote "Hell is the place where nothing connects" by writer T.S Eliot. Monique van de Kerkhof on this: ‚Äúlife consists of falling and getting up again and again. Who gets up again, connects with people. When you are no longer connected to people, life is like hell ‚Äù. The music in the film was composed by Monique and performed in collaboration with students from the Maastricht Conservatory.

name: Noam (Nani) Vazana
skills: ['Singer/Songwriter', 'Film Scoring', 'Pianist', 'Trombone', 'Acting', 'Vocal Coaching', 'Vocal Performance', 'Vocal Training', 'Vocal Production', 'Piano Performance', 'Piano', 'Opera', 'jazz', 'POP', 'Musicianship', 'Lyricist', 'Jazz', 'Singing', 'Musicians', 'Music']
summary:
Noam ‚ÄúNani‚Äù Vazana is one of the only artists in the world that write & compose new songs in the endangered Ladino language. In her new album ‚ÄòKe Haber‚Äô (What‚Äôs New) she captures the spirit of the ancient, matriarchal language and culture and propels it into the 21st century with socially pertinent lyrics, celebrating migration, gender and female empowerment. 

The soundscape bridges over tradition and modern life, capturing the sounds and smells of the marketplace and fuses them with raw, flamenco like vocals and surprising instrumentations. Soft choral-like trombones embellish mariachi guitars & percussion with glimpses of piano & cello tracks, make this record a magical realistic mosaic. Nani unveils a piece of history we don‚Äôt easily find in other mythology & anthropology.

Nani represented the Netherlands at the EU Music Festival Vietnam and performed at the Kennedy Center USA, the London Jazz Festival UK and the Jodhpur RIFF festival India. Nani showcased at APAP USA, Jazzahead DE and Injazz NL. The held talks at TEDx Amsterdam NL & hosted 3 WOMEX panels. The Dutch NPO network released a mini documentary about her musical work and she also composed music for BBC4 and NPO documentaries.

Nani is a professor at the London Performing Academy of Music and the Jerusalem Music Academy, she chairs of the Amsterdam Artist Collective and founded WhyDIYMusic.com and NovaProductions.eu

Awards:
ACUM Album Award, IL 2021
PAIS Album Award, IL 2020
SENA Album Award, NL 2019
Arts Council England Premiere Award, UK 2019
Sephardic Music Award, ES 2017
iTunes Top-20 bestseller, NL 2015
ACUM Album Award, IL 2011

name: Tim van Zoeren
skills: ['New Media', 'Editing', 'Film', 'Photoshop', 'Web Video', 'CMS', 'Content Management', 'Reviews', 'Social Media', 'Research', 'Microsoft Office', 'Management', 'Content Writing', 'Science', 'Data Management', 'Philosophy', 'CSS', 'JavaScript', 'HTML', 'PHP']
summary:
As someone with a academic background and a passion for film and TV-drama, I always wanted to help people experience content regarding philosophical, aesthetic, scientific or otherwise important aspects of life, that I find to be pertinent to a satisfying existence. This audience includes myself, for I am never done improving. Ongoing personal reconstruction is key.

That last part is a bit of a personal quest, fueled by the art form known as cinema. Because, as great filmmaker Christopher Boe once put it: ‚ÄúCinema is a wonderful medium to get to know life. It's sort of a backstage pass into life where we can experience things before we experience them in real life.‚Äù As Boe's masterpiece Reconstruction shows us: in film we can reconstruct life and it's problems and learn from the consequences characters face based on their actions.

I thought making movies, or writing about them firsthand, wouldn't be possible. So much has already been said, sung or shown by great artists like Boe, that I'm not sure I would become anything more than just another voice lost in the white noise that is our current media landscape. Working for Ximon and Cinetree, who distributed less known but far more interesting content, enabled me to try and make sure that wouldn't happen to others.

Still, over the years, I gradually shifted back to production and in 2015 I founded Sure Thing Video. After some time freelancing, in 2019 I joined Yelow Jersey, my biggest client, as a Senior Content Creator. Just before all hell broke loose. 

It's my goal to become a fully capable video editor and color grader and i've also been one-man-banding ever-expanding rigs with Blackmagic and Z Cam cinema camera's at their core. Being self-tought and a quick study to boot, i'm always eager (and able) to find shortcuts, connect dots and improve efficiency.

After 35 great years in Unilever, of which more than 20 years in director's roles across R&D, Engineering & Technology and Manufacturing, I founded in 2017 Askainos Consulting b.v..

As Principal Consultant I deliver Manufacturing, Technology and Innovation expertise to FMCG leaders. I support them in dealing with challenges as: how to develop a site Masterplan and how to scope and write a brief for new production facilities or a factory extension? How can I get more synergy out of factory networks in the country or around the globe? How can I set-up a multi-year value improvement project portfolio?

Having lived in 4 European countries and working in roles that made me travel across the globe has greatly strengthened my interpersonal and cultural sensitivities, I connect easily with people on all levels. Deeply rooted in the FMCG world in general, I have specialist knowledge in the area of Ice Cream. 

In my 5 years as Global Supply Chain Program Director for Ben & Jerry's I have had day-to-day experience in what it takes to run and grow a purpose-led business. 

My unique selling point is that I can give the support in Manufacturing & Technology with a sound understanding of the Marketing, R&D, and End-to-End Supply Chain aspects. From local to global, also in an acquisition / due diligence. 

Askainos Consulting: your Sparring Partner for the Manufacturing & Technology side of your Business.

skills: ['Writing', 'Social Media', 'English', 'Dutch', 'Teaching', 'Event Management', 'Art', 'Acting', 'Research', 'Performing Arts', 'Film', 'Theatre']
summary:
Sofie Kramer (1990) is an Amsterdam-based theatermaker, performer and writer. Deriving from personal experiences, she examines her inner world from a political and philosophical perspective to tell bigger stories about the influence of power structures on the individual. In this search, she strongly relies on - and rebels against - antique sources such as Greek mythology. The fighting body is a returning theme in her work: the body that tries to fight time, gravity, the gaze of the other. She shows these fights in physical, strongly visual and often multidisciplinary performances, musicality and the body always being the starting point of the process. 
She graduated in 2019 at the Directing department of the Institute of Performative Arts in Maastricht. Before, she studied Acting at the Hogeschool voor de Kunsten Utrecht and Literary and Cultural Studies at the University of Amsterdam. She worked as a director's assistent at Orkater, Internationaal Theater Amsterdam and Productiehuis Rotterdam. She played her soloperformance Er is je nooit een rozentuin beloofd, about the loss of her mother, at the Boslab Theaterfestival 2020 in the Amsterdamse Bostheater.

summary:
I am a special education teacher working primarily with pupils with educational needs. My work consists in teaching and pedagogical guidance of students with special needs at the secondary school level. 

As a teacher I give individual classes in philosophy, classics and mathematics.  I also help pupils to develop their study skills by working on various subjects. Finally I seek to establish a dialogue with the parents and the school to find solutions that fit the educational needs of the student.

I was educated at Leiden University (Philosophy and Literature) and Accademia Vivarium Novum, Rome (Classics). While in Rome I came to the conclusion that my own educational needs had not been fully met by regular education. For me this was the beginning of a search for the needs of gifted students and students who have a special learning profile. I hope that my experience will help younger people, so that they may be able to find their unique path in life.

the power of visual design.
Visualization is a powerful method that uses the imagination of yourself and that of your target group. This enables them to attract and accomplish goals in their lifes and delivers you a great return on those business needs. 

The language of the mind
Language in itself is the most complex human behaviour. I'm always curious to what more there is than what people say, the thing we call spoken language, and how it's connected with that which drives our motivations.

The essence of teamwork

summary:
Bates became recognised for a body of work, or ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô dresses, made during the 1990‚Äôs following her graduation from Glasgow School of Art, Scotland. Constructed from knitted human hair, the dresses have been exhibited extensively in Europe as well as in the USA and Japan, including in Revelation at the Barbican Centre Curve Gallery, London and the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto, 1997; Addressing the Century: 100 Years of Art and Fashion at the Hayward Gallery, London and Kunstmuseum, Wolfsburg, 1998; Weaving the World at Yokohama Museum of Art, 1999; Out of the Closet and The Unexpected, at Sotheby‚Äôs Auctioneers in London, 2000 and New York, 2001; and Body Extensions at Mudac ‚Äì Mus√©e de design et d‚Äôarts appliqu√©s contemporains, Lausanne, 2004.

In 1997, she was awarded the prestigious Scottish Arts Council artists residency in Amsterdam, which subsequently became her base. She has since travelled frequently to remote and high altitude locations and communities for in-depth research into sacred and transitional landscapes. 

She received further artist residency and fellowship awards, notably from the Pier Arts Centre, Orkney, 2000; Nordiska Akvarellmuseet, Sweden, 2000; S-Air in Sapporo, Japan, 2002-3; Lijiang Studio, China, 2006 and 2007; and as the Dutch Affiliated Visual Arts Fellow at the American Academy in Rome in 2008. 
During 2013-14 she undertook a nomadic residency as part of Il Ventre di Napoli in Italy, with support from the Mondriaan Fund. 
In 2017 she was selected by the Mondriaan Fund and MMCA Museum of Modern Art Seoul to undertake a 4 month artist in residence in South Korea.
During the summer of 2021 she was resident with Vincent Van Gogh Huis museum in Brabant, on the estate of De Moeren, weaving narratives and histories of the land into a new series of works with photography, peat and black ink.

Solo exhibitions and publications include: Casino Forum d‚Äôart contemporain, Luxembourg; Arendt & Medernach photography collection, Luxembourg; MUDAM Mus√©e d‚ÄôArt Moderne Grand-Duc Jean, Luxembourg.

Acquisitions of her work have been made for the collections of MUDAM Mus√©e d‚ÄôArt Moderne Grand-Duc Jean, Luxembourg; Arendt & Medernach photography collection, Luxembourg; MAC‚Äôs Mus√©e des Arts Contemporains, Grand Hornu, Belgium; FRAC Fonds r√©gional d‚Äôart contemporain Poitou-Charentes, Angouleme, France; Nottingham Castle Museum, England; Paisley Art Gallery and Museum, Scotland; and for private collections in Austria, Belgium, Britain, China, Italy, Japan, Italy, Luxembourg, Spain, South Korea, Switzerland, USA and the Netherlands.

summary:
Hi there, I'm Erik, happy to take a moment to introduce myself. You can find a selection of things I've done in my (semi-)professional life below. But more importantly I like to share what I enjoy doing.

After working in sustainability consulting, startups and web development, I decided to canoe in the Amazon. This kind of worked out and it became quite a longer journey and adventure then planned. Jungle areas, plants and ecosystems grasped my attention as well as how our relation is to nature.

Health of our natural environments, traditional ways and our personal health always interested me, but it became much more after traveling and living in permaculture communities.

This led me to a new project: Pure Kakaw sparked from the fascination of how cacao was used traditionally and the benefits it has for our body & mind. Nature is an incredible source for learning, to increase our potential and live healthily.

It is a true joy to work directly with farmers in different places in Central & South America. To source a fair and healthy product, and to support agroforestry farming and planting more trees.


Some other fields of interest:
- Meditation
- Permaculture
- Mycology
- Cacao
- Regenerative Agroforestry

summary:
Born in Leeuwarden (Netherlands) in 1958. Studied at the Academy of Arts and Industrial Design in Eindhoven. Self-taught in the art of bronze sculpture.   In 1989, after a period as painter he concentrated  himself completely on sculpting. His inspiration lies in the world of mythology and the remains of old and lost cultures.  Subjects come from the Celtic and Mediaeval Literature, such as the legend of King Arthur, the Holy Grail, Percival and Irish fairy-tales. Also are the old cultures of Egypt and Africa nourishing sources of inspiration.  The sculptures are very long and stretched out in their shapes .Often the figures have a modest attitude. The sculptures are modelled in wax and cast in bronze by the lost-wax-method (cire-perdue). 
Published with his wife 3 books with photo‚Äôs and poems. After 2006 also exhibitions with his photography.

summary:
I am trained as a philosopher and historian, and am deeply interested in our relations to the past. My work seeks to delve deeper into the complexities of the past, exploring how its affects inform our understanding of the present and the self and our ways of facing the future. I have a specific passion for Italian art and culture, and have written papers on the reception of antiquity by Raphael and his patrons, the exploitation of the undiscovered self by fascism and populism, and relations to the past and the future in the films of Paolo Sorrentino. I believe that by examining the ways in which history, philosophy, and rhetoric intersect, we can gain a fruitful understanding of the human condition and our place within the world.

Whether through my writing, speaking engagements or consultancy services, I am committed to revitalizing the past for a future that is better than the present we are enduring.

name: J. Constantine
skills: ['Production Management', 'Sound Design', 'Music', 'Project Management', 'Project Coordination', 'Multimedia', 'Vocals', 'Guitar Playing', 'Piano', 'Drums', 'Music Industry', 'Marketing', 'Social Media Marketing', 'Live Sound', 'Lighting Design', 'Sales', 'Project Planning', 'Management', 'Tutoring', 'Public Speaking']
summary:
I am critically obsessed with sonic branding. I touch the sound with my bare hands and turn it into an earworm. I am the goosebumps on your arm. I am the memories and feelings. I am the absolute connection between sound and visual content.

Nothing extraordinary, just my usual pipeline as the founder and creative director of WAVEME.PRO LLC Creative Audio Lab - an award-winning studio that has composed music and sound design for almost every A-list brand around the world, including Mercedes-Benz, Microsoft, BMW, HP, Unilever, Porsche, Jaguar, Apple, Toyota, Genesis, etc.

I've been responsible for music and sound for projects such as EXPO 2020 in Dubai, an immersive installation at Microsoft EBC in Redmond, the Nexus Arabia opening show in Riyadh, the Mercedes-Benz AMG GT launch in Beijing, the History Hall Museum in Montreal, the BMW 5-Series launch in Jakarta, the Jaguar Racing Formula season launches in London and many others. 

‚Ä®My 10+ years of experience as a sound producer inevitably led me to see, imagine and feel the sound. If I hear music - I automatically separate instruments, looking for hooks and details, and explore harmony and melodic patterns. I take sounds in the street by default as the noise painting that defines my existence. One day, I stopped resisting it, deciding to use this gift for the benefit of all life in our galaxy.‚Ä®

Inspired by the research work of Prof. Marcel Cobussen and Prof. Hafez Isma√Øli M'Hamdi of Leiden University, a neurobiologist Prof. Dale Purves of Duke University, and Dr. James Humberstone of The University of Sydney, I started my own research activity. I began to study how audio content affects the emotional construct of the human brain. I immersed myself in a brand new direction of applied psychology. It is based on the theory of parallels and the evolutionary response of human genetic stages to specific rhythmic and melodic patterns. 

Later I started exploring the possibilities of AI in audio production and launched two startups aimed at simplifying the work of the sound designer and composer. 

My background as a spacecraft engineer combined with my musical education and experience as a light artist gave me the opportunity to look at multimedia storytelling from both a technical and an artistic perspective. My move to Dubai has transformed these components into a single vector - a mission of creating a magnificent future around the world using all my skills and talents. ‚Ä®

Buckle up, our space shuttle is off!
In the meantime...

Get in touch, and let's create something amazing together!
cos@waveme.pro

name: Peter Hylarides
skills: ['English', 'Publishing', 'Writing', 'International Relations', 'Dutch', 'Copywriting', 'Editing', 'Translation', 'Magazines', 'History', 'Social Media']
summary:
From 2002 till 2012 I wrote for the British Oxford-based magazine Contemporary Review. This magazine was founded in 1866 as a platform for intelligent discussion and debate. Contributors were, amongst others, W.E. Gladstone, J.M. Barrie and Aldous Huxley. In 1956 Contemporary Review acquired Fortnightly, founded by Anthony Trollope. Unfortunately, the last printed edition was published in 2013. Since then the magazine has been ‚Äòdormant‚Äô.
Specializing in contemporary history and international affairs, I'd rather see myself more as a generalist than a specialist. In Contemporary Review I have published a wide variety of articles, book reviews and interviews. Some examples of my articles are:
‚ÄúThe Netherlands: From Euroscepticism to Europhoria‚Äù (2001)
‚ÄúEurope and the New Constitution‚Äù (2004)
‚ÄúQueen Juliana of the Netherlands, 1909-2004‚Äù (2004)
‚ÄúMulticulturalism in the Netherlands and the Murder of Theo Van Gogh‚Äù (2005)
‚ÄúVoters in the Netherlands Defy the European Constitution‚Äù
‚ÄúGeorge Kennan: The Career of a Cold War Diplomat‚Äù (2006)
‚ÄúDutch Politics: Exchanging Neo-Liberalism for Social Conservatism‚Äù (2007)
‚ÄúThe Dutch Commission‚Äôs Report on the Iraq War‚Äù (2010)
‚ÄúThe Netherlands and its Minority Government‚Äù (2011)
‚ÄúEurope: Quo Vadis?‚Äù (2012)
Aside from articles I have also written many book reviews and conducted interviews. In 2014 I contributed to ‚ÄúFarewell MD-11‚Äù: this publication looks at the twenty years of service of this three-engined icon McDonnell Douglas MD-11 with KLM Royal Dutch Airlines. ‚ÄúFarewell MD-11‚Äù was published in October 2014 by KLM Flight Operations.

I am always on the lookout for writing opportunities and will continue to do so. It is, however, my aim to combine my work in aviation with a (new) career in education. When I was a student I gained my first experience in education through a course at university and I also taught for two years at a tourism and hospitality school. I want to find a school that is willing to give me the opportunity to teach whilst obtaining my teaching degree.
