summary:
You probably don't want or have time to read my entire bio „ÉÑ
In a nutshell:

‚úì Creative and enthusiastic Dutch translator and language specialist
‚úì Informal and personal approach
‚úì 10+ years of experience
‚úì Language Lead and Expert for multiple accounts, like Airbnb, Cricut and Woolrich
‚úìQA Specialist (language quality, individual and team performance of Dutch freelance translators and teams)

Even though I encourage you to read on (because I get quite some emails asking me for projects I have to decline for various reasons), if you think you have all the information you need, you can contact me at  m.r.terbrugge[at]gmail.com to discuss options.

--------------------

Now, if you do have some more time, let me tell you a little more about myself:

My name is Marlieke and I'm an enthusiastic freelance Dutch Translator and Language Quality Specialist with more than 10 years experience both as an in-house and freelance translator for companies like Airbnb, Sublime, Cricut and PandaDoc. In these years I've focussed mainly on the travel and marketing industry, and am currently the Dutch Language Lead for (among others) Airbnb at Translated (managing the Dutch team of freelance translators and monitoring quality) and the Language Expert for Cricut, where I work closely with the localization manager and local team as well to bring language quality in their products and services to the next level for the Dutch market.

That's the business side of things. In my free time, I really love to write and create. From creative journaling and poetry to drawing and painting with watercolor. In spring and summer, you will most likely find me outside in nature (if the Dutch weather allows it), either gardening, taking photographs or exploring the forest with my two year old daughter and labrador. It's a nice change from all the time I spend in front of my computer ;) Aside from that, I also practice yoga and meditation daily, and like to binge watch a good series every now and then.

My business has evolved over the years from taking every translation job I can get to only working on projects I'm truly passionate about.  If you think we could be a match and you need:

‚û´ A Dutch translation of your English website, article, blog etc. (or review of existing Dutch content)
‚û´ Dutch subtitles for series, movies or documentaries or a QC specialist
‚û´ A Language Specialist to assess the translation quality of your current translator database
‚û´ A Dutch Language Lead

I'd love for you to contact me and say hi at m.r.terbrugge[at]gmail.com.

name: Bhaskar Hande
skills: ['Art', 'Publishing', 'Books', 'Poetry', 'Arts Administration', 'Social Media', 'Journalism', 'Editing', 'Creative Writing', 'Blogging', 'Film Production', 'Film', 'Microsoft Office', 'Entertainment', 'Event Management', 'Screenwriting', 'Content Development', 'Social Networking', 'Acting', 'Magazines']
summary:
Bhaskar Hande was born in 1957 in Umbraj, district Pune, India.
He lives and works in The Hague, The Netherlands since 1983. He is a versatile artist.
His ambitions to be busy with verious disciplines of art, identifies him as the poet, painter,
sculptor and graphic designer. He published three books of collection of poems in 1990,
1995 and 2001. The project 'Your form is my creation' is his visual tribute to seventeen
century Bhakti poet 'Tukaram' has become first in it's kind of Indian history. Hande's
Indianness is not ethnicity worn on the sleeve; it is the very substance of his cultural
identity in multicultural global community of artists. Hande has been living many years
in Europe,


his cultural signature has remained the same. Apart from his development Hande thinks
day to day life, living and working in another country and culture than where he grew up.
This process gives him creative impulses; every year he lives a couple of months in India,
vice versa in Europe. He exhibits in India and in Europe. The change in surrounding keeps
his thoughts constant in process. His works represent meditative fall of his merging
colours and changing environments. The colours become brighter , forms are clear than
ever and words are more mysteries.
